page.title: 09THE WILLIAM GILPIN SCHOOL
page.content: Schools<state>Church of England Aided. Pilley Village School called "William Gilpin"after its clergman founder,was set up in 1802 for the instruction of children of day labourers.It now has 51 pupils aged 5-11 years,a Headmaster 2 teachers,a secretary a caretaker and kitchen staff plus various other paid and voluntary part-timers.The original building,now a private house stands on the opposite side of the road from the present building which dates from 1875.Red brick and typical Victorian style it has 3 class rooms and a library recently transformed from an office and stroe room.Staff and sec. now use a Portacabin in the playground. A breeze block building provides kitchen and dining room for mid-day meals.There is a hard surfaced playground and a large playing field. A good basic education is aimed at.
